snippet: Over one million Syrian children live in Turkey, and thousands work in factories or sweatshops to provide for their families, rather than attend school.
abstract: Over one million young Syrians have fled tumultuous war at home to Turkey, where, unable to attend school, thousands work under inhumane conditions supporting their families; nearly three million Syrian children are out of school, and for those in Turkey, education gap has either grown longer or become permanent.

byline.contributor: Sarah Dadouch and Karam Shoumali contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Over one million Syrian children live in Turkey, and thousands work in factories or sweatshops to provide for their families, rather than attend school.

headline.main: In Turkey, a Syrian Child ‘Has to Work to Survive’
